item.title: Getting started with loops
item.description: Types of loops # A loop is a control flow structure to definitely or indefinitely run a set of statement written only once in code, until a certain condition is met or the process is terminated. Condition loops # These loops are repeated based on the state of their conditions. For loops # For loops are usually run upon a variable as the subject of iteration. For example, for loops can be run upon an integer to limit the number of times the loop should be run, or upon an array to iterate over it.
